instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi guy iv got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan is spinning very fast and running slow any one got the Ad S3156 software so I can run a hardwaretest on it 

cheers

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
EFI version should be good enough...
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1QWuvVuIU-k8Cyur23Gxf_2IJmo5TxoVb[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Thank you do you think If all fails I should reball SMC IT WAS LIQUID DAMAGED

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Did you run the ASD?
General fail on SMC sensors can be solved by reballing sometime.
But also could be missing AVREF voltage for SMC...

When appreciate liquid signs around SMC, is better to reball it.
